revised_title: Study of Water and Aeriform Matter in Crystalline Cavities
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy examines the state of water and aeriform matter in cavities found in certain crystals. He finds that the fluid is nearly pure water and the gas is mostly azote, existing in a state of rarefaction. The author suggests that atmospheric air might have been originally included and that the oxygen might have been absorbed by the water. The results obtained are difficult to explain unless by supposing the water and silica separated from each other at a very high temperature.
